Module com.example.umlscd
Package com.example.umlscd.BusinessLayer.ClassDiagram

Class AssociationManager

java.lang.Object
com.example.umlscd.BusinessLayer.ClassDiagram.ClassDiagramRelationsManager
com.example.umlscd.BusinessLayer.ClassDiagram.AssociationManager
public class AssociationManager extends ClassDiagramRelationsManager

Association Manager

The AssociationManager is responsible for creating and rendering association relationships between classes in a UML class diagram. This class handles the creation of association lines, multiplicity labels, and relationship labels, as well as dynamically updating these elements when classes are moved.

It inherits from ClassDiagramRelationsManager and implements the abstract method createRelationship(javafx.scene.layout.VBox, javafx.scene.layout.VBox, javafx.scene.layout.Pane, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String), which is used to create an association relationship between two classes.

Authors: Ahmad Wyne, Wahaj Asif, Muhammad Muneeb

Version: 1.0

Since: 2024-12-04

  • Constructor Details

    • AssociationManager

      public AssociationManager(ClassDiagramManager manager)
      Constructs an AssociationManager instance.

      This constructor initializes the manager with the specified ClassDiagramManager and enables the association mode by default.

      Parameters:
      manager - The ClassDiagramManager instance managing the overall diagram.

  • Method Details

    • createRelationship

      public void createRelationship(javafx.scene.layout.VBox start, javafx.scene.layout.VBox end, javafx.scene.layout.Pane drawingPane, String associationName, String startMultiplicity, String endMultiplicity)
      Creates an association relationship between two classes.

      This method calculates the closest boundary points of the two given VBox elements representing the classes and creates an association line between them. It also creates labels for the association name and the multiplicity of both ends of the relationship. The line and labels are added to the drawingPane.

      Specified by:
      createRelationship in class ClassDiagramRelationsManager
      Parameters:
      start - The starting class (VBox) for the association.
      end - The ending class (VBox) for the association.
      drawingPane - The pane where the association line and labels will be drawn.
      associationName - The name of the association.
      startMultiplicity - The multiplicity at the start of the association (e.g., "1", "0..*").
      endMultiplicity - The multiplicity at the end of the association (e.g., "1", "0..*").

    • addEditDialogOnClick

      public void addEditDialogOnClick(javafx.scene.text.Text textElement, String dialogTitle, Consumer<String> onSave)
      This function adds a dialog to edit association name and multiplicity labels.

      Sets up a double-click event handler on the given Text element to display a text input dialog for editing the text value. When the user double-clicks the Text element, a dialog is shown to allow them to enter a new value. If the user enters a new value and presses "OK", the provided onSave consumer is called with the new value.

      Parameters:
      textElement - The Text element that will trigger the edit dialog on double-click.
      dialogTitle - The title of the text input dialog.
      onSave - A Consumer<String> that will be called with the new value entered by the user. This consumer allows for custom handling of the new value (e.g., saving it or updating the UI).

    • createRelationshipFromModel

      public void createRelationshipFromModel(UMLRelationship umlRelationship, javafx.scene.layout.Pane drawingPane)
      Creates an association relationship from a UMLRelationship model object during deserialization.

      This method recreates an association relationship using data from a UMLRelationship object and adds the elements (line, labels) to the specified drawingPane.

      Parameters:
      umlRelationship - The UMLRelationship data containing information about the association.
      drawingPane - The pane where the association elements will be drawn.

    • getLastRelationshipBox

      public UMLRelationshipBox getLastRelationshipBox()
      Retrieves the last created UMLRelationshipBox.

      This method returns the last created UMLRelationshipBox, which contains information about the most recently created relationship.

      Returns:
      The last UMLRelationshipBox created.

    • addDynamicUpdateListener

      public void addDynamicUpdateListener(javafx.scene.shape.Line line, javafx.scene.layout.VBox startBox, javafx.scene.layout.VBox endBox, javafx.scene.text.Text associationLabel, javafx.scene.text.Text startMultiplicityText, javafx.scene.text.Text endMultiplicityText)
      Adds dynamic listeners to update the association line and labels when classes are moved.

      This method attaches listeners to the VBox elements representing the classes involved in the association. The listeners update the position of the association line and labels when the classes are moved.

      Parameters:
      line - The association line to be updated.
      startBox - The VBox representing the starting class.
      endBox - The VBox representing the ending class.
      associationLabel - The label for the association name.
      startMultiplicityText - The label for the start multiplicity.
      endMultiplicityText - The label for the end multiplicity.
